text.0: Children with #tetralogyoffallot have changing needs as they transition into adulthood. Learn about adult #congenitalheartdefect care from a @HopkinsKids expert. https://t.co/VASrWJODS6
text.1: “I’m lucky to have gone into medicine because it’s been so interesting,” says Tom Powell. “As a side effect, it also lets you do beneficial things for other people.” https://t.co/8qMAwU79C2
text.2:
Congrats to @kotwalsusrutha and team who were awarded @ImproveDX‘s DXQI Seed Grant! Their award winning research focuses on improving #diagnosis of #dizziness & #stroke through virtual patient education.

Read more about the grant and the team’s work:  https://t.co/BT0XBXD0IH https://t.co/JTHxNkXxtO
text.3:
"Critiques on women’s bodies & dress means physicians who identify as female must spend energy ensuring they look as they “should” to pts & colleagues. This energy is better focused on giving clinically excellent care." @CchristmColleen @HopkinsMedicine 

https://t.co/ETPNHkfZwy
text.4: It can take time to adjust to life after being treated for #COVID19 in the hospital. Rehabilitation specialists can connect you to the right people to get you back on track. https://t.co/F8tEonrVj1
text.5: Did you know that Afib is the most common type of irregular heartbeat, affecting more than 5 million adults in the United States? Here are the five facts you need to know: https://t.co/AWOl9KbgAn
